properties.areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 3:40AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
Northeast winds will rapidly strengthen on Sunday morning as a
strong low pressure moves east across the northern Pacific. Near
blizzard conditions may be possible for St. Lawrence Island with
blowing snow and potential for visibilities of a quarter to half
mile visibility. There is still uncertainty of the strength of
winds, but could possibly reach sustained winds of 35 mph with
gusts to 55 mph. These conditions will continue into early next
week as the northeast winds persist.

Please take proper precautions prior to the deteriorating
conditions that are expected to develop later this weekend and
continuing into early next week. For the latest forecasts and
weather information, visit www.weather.gov/afg.

NWSheadline: Strong winds and reduced visibility returning to St. Lawrence Island
